intro: Senecio vulgarihumilis, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–60 cm, with hairy, linear leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Senecio vulgarihumilis is an annual plant, completing its life cycle within one growing season.
